title: SAM best practice
content:
This section gives you a best practice of how to use SAM to manage product compliance.

Prerequisites

SAM calculates license consumption based on the inventory data in UCMDB. Typically, the inventory data includes software CIs, node CIs, and their relationships. Many modern server applications are deployed on virtual machines and are licensed considering the underlying physical infrastructure, usually including information of the physical device, physical processor, and the virtualization technologies used to build the virtual machine. Therefore, the relationships between the virtual machine and its hosted device are also required. To collect sufficient inventory data for license consumption calculation, you need to configure the proper inventory discovery jobs by using the Universal Discovery capability. Note that to leverage the Universal Discovery capability of UD/UCMDB, you must have a UCMDB installation that Service Management supports (see the integration support matrix).

  1. Discover software CIs, node CIs, processor CIs, and their relationships
    Configure relevant discovery jobs under the Hosts and Resources > Inventory Discovery category. Software recognition is critical to ensure license compliance as part of SAM. We suggest running the Inventory Discovery by Scanner job to discovery installed software which is able to recognize and normalize more than 138,000 software titles based on Software Application Index (SAI) files. You can download package from ITOM Marketplace and update it on a monthly basis.
  2. Discover the relationships between the virtual machine and its underlying physical infrastructure
    Configure relevant discovery jobs under the Could and Virtualization > Virtualization category. 
  3. Discover clusters
    Configure relevant discovery jobs under the Clustering and Load Balancing > Failover Clusters and Clustering and Load Balancing > Load Balancers categories. 

For more information about configuring relevant discovery jobs under different categories, refer to the Discovery Modules topic in Universal Discovery Content Pack online documentation.

(Optional) Deploy sample data

For demo or testing purposes, you can deploy SAM's sample data in your environment planned to run SAM.

To deploy sample data, follow these steps:

  1. Go to the ITOM Marketplace, and download the applicable SAM Sample Data package including a zip file for UD/UCMDB and a pkb file for Service Management.

  2. To deploy the package in your demo environment, follow specific steps depending on your system.
    • If you're using UD/UCMDB, two options are available: deploy the package from UCMDB Local Client or deploy the package from UCMDB UI.

  3. Check the deployment status of SAM sample data in your demo environment. You need to confirm whether SAM's major data modules, such as the OOTB product list, configurations, and compliance reports, have been successfully imported into your environment.

Must-have steps for using SAM

  1. Configure the license models in Service Management. Besides the basic information, make sure that you configure the following fields correctly. See Edit a license model.
    • Currency
    • Count per pack
    • Pack price
    • License metric
    • Product version
  2. Configure the licenses in Service Management. Make sure that the license is in one of the following phases: Prepare, Pool, or Receive. See Edit a license record.
  3. Follow the data flow process described in the following section Generate a compliance report for on-premises products to calculate product compliance.

Note: To calculate license compliance for Adobe products, you also need to entitle the users and assign an owner to the device. See Create compliance reports for products using user-based license rules.

Data flow

From UD/UCMDB, SAM can collect data on software installation, hardware, and software products through the UD/UCMDB gateway. From Service Management, SAM collects license information through the gateway. Based on the license information and the out-of-the-box (OOTB) license rules, SAM calculates license consumption and reserves licenses for devices. The calculation result appears on a compliance dashboard. For SaaS products, SAM retrieves product subscription data through the SaaS API.

Data preparation

This table describes the key steps for data preparation.

Action Reference Description
Build a product list Products > Synchronize the product family Builds a list of products that are installed on the physical machines from UD/UCMDB.

You can also do this manually.

Configuration

This table describes the key steps for license-related configurations.

Action Reference Description
Configure license models License models

Enables you to set the relationships between product versions and license models and between license metrics and license models, and set the minimum count and price per pack.

For cost-effectiveness, we recommend that you select the highest product version available for your license. Later you can configure the downgrade matrix to enable lower-version product installations to consume the higher-version license.

Note: If you enabled the new SAM solution in Service Management, we recommend that you remove the legacy License metric field by using Studio because the field is included in the Software coverage section for SAM.
Configure license rules Products > Configure license rules for a product

Enables you to link OOTB license rules to products. 

Note: For the calculation to work correctly, the license metric of the license rule must be the same as that configured for the license model.
Manage licenses Licenses Enables you to set relationships between license models and licenses.
Maintain license compatibility matrix Products > Maintain license compatibility matrix Enables you to manage the upgrade and downgrade matrix between product versions.

Calculation

This table describes the key steps for calculating license consumption.

Action Reference Description
Calculate license consumption Products > Calculate license consumption

Products > Define a scheduler

 Calculates license consumption per device and reserves licenses for the devices if the licenses are available in Service Management.

Analyze compliance report Analysis Enables you to learn more about license compliance per device and how licenses are consumed.
